New Records: England scored 337/9, their highest score in the ICC World Cup since 2016.
David Willey was named Player of the Match after contributing 15 runs and 3 wickets.
Haris Rauf scored 35 runs at a strike rate of 152.17, the highest by any Pakistan batter.
This was Pakistan's highest total in the World Cup since 2017.
England won by 93 runs, their second-highest margin in the World Cup after 2019.
Key Match Events: Ben Stokes became the first England batter to score 80+ runs in the first 50 overs of a World Cup match.
Jos Buttler became the fastest England batter to reach 150 runs (in 47.2 overs).
Chris Woakes took 3 wickets for 27 runs, his best ODI figures in ODIs since 2015.
Haris Rauf became the fastest Pakistan batter to reach 100 runs (in 43.3 overs).
The match was England's highest-scoring ODI in the World Cup since 2016.
Pakistan's 244/10 was their second-highest total in the World Cup after 2017.
Pre-Game Insights: England elected to bat first after winning the toss.
Pakistan's bowling attack was expected to be challenging, especially with Shaheen Shah Afridi and Haris Rauf.
England focused on their powerplay performance, aiming to capitalize on quick runs.
Pakistan hoped to exploit swing and turn, targeting England's middle order.
Post-Match Reflections: David Willey celebrated his Man-of-the-Match award with a dive in the crowd, showcasing his passion.
England's players expressed relief after a tough series and praised the team's resilience.
The win gave England momentum ahead of the World Cup, with captain Jos Buttler calling it a significant boost.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was a day-night encounter, played under lights at Eden Gardens.
The attendance was 37,661, a near-full house for an ODI in Kolkata.
The match flow was influenced by strategic decisions and key moments, including several reviews.
Others: This was the 44th match of the 2023-24 ICC World Cup, with England and Pakistan clashing in a crucial group stage encounter.
The match marked Pakistan's second consecutive loss in the World Cup after their defeat to India.
